ARTICLE.TITLE: Kenji Yaguchi: “Our government didn’t want us. Nobody wanted us. It was a terrible, terrible thing.”
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Crossville, TN (38555)

Today

Sunshine and clouds mixed. A stray shower or thunderstorm is possible. High 81F. Winds NNW at 5 to 10 mph..

Tonight

A stray shower or thunderstorm is possible early. Clear to partly cloudy. Low 64F. Winds NNW at 5 to 10 mph.

METADATA.keywords: kenji yaguchi, concentration camp, military, weaponry, american, lost battalion, regiment, battle, soldier, crossville, tn, cumberland county, tn, world war ii, wwii
METADATA.news_keywords: kenji yaguchi, concentration camp, military, weaponry, american, lost battalion, regiment, battle, soldier, crossville, tn, cumberland county, tn, world war ii, wwii
METADATA.description: Kenji Yaguchi said, “I volunteered from a concentration camp.” He was incarcerated in an American concentration camp in 1942, and subsequently volunteered to enlist, serving in the 442nd Regimental Combat
METADATA.author: Rebekah Bohannon Beeler

og.title: Kenji Yaguchi: “Our government didn’t want us. Nobody wanted us. It was a  terrible, terrible thing.”
og.description: Kenji Yaguchi said, “I volunteered from a concentration camp.” He was incarcerated in an American concentration camp in 1942, and subsequently volunteered to enlist, serving in the 442nd Regimental Combat
